headline.main: China Clamps Down on Web, Pinching Companies Like Google

docs.abstract: Chinese government, as part of broad campaign to tighten internal security, is clamping down on web traffic, making it more difficult for Google and its customers to do business; even as Google and other big tech firms have lobbied heavily for easing of restrictions, China's broader scrutiny of multinationals has intensified.

docs.snippet: DEAN--Charles R.,passed away peacefully at home aged 89 surrounded by his family on September 26. Chuck graduated from Harvard in 1946 also serving for three years in the Navy aboard the USS Sargent Bay during WWII. In 1960 he received his Ph.D. i...
docs.lead_paragraph: DEAN--Charles R.,passed away peacefully at home aged 89 surrounded by his family on September 26. Chuck graduated from Harvard in 1946 also serving for three years in the Navy aboard the USS Sargent Bay during WWII. In 1960 he received his Ph.D. in Economics from Columbia University. He was a true renaissance man in addition to having his own economic consulting firm, he was a photographer, carpenter, jeweler, sailor, chef, gardener, book-a-day reader, and our Google before there was a Google. He is survived by his beloved wife of 48 years, Betsy Dean, his daughters Merrick, Peggy and Judy, sons Ky and David, three sons-in-law, four grandsons and a great granddaughter. He will be deeply missed by all his friends and extended family. There will be a memorial service on Tuesday, October 14, at 11:30am at The New York Society for Ethical Culture, 2 West 64th Street, New York, NY.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  DEAN, CHARLES R.
